is an innovation card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
The settlement no longer fears the
darkness. Letting go means your resolve
cannot be cracked.

Add +2 to all Brain Trauma rolls.

Whenever a survivor dies, draw 1 basic resource and add it to settlement storage. Do not gain a resource if a survivor is lost, ceases to exist, or is exiled.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
Amidst the endless stone faces, the event revealer notices an unusual object on the ground. The event revealer investigates and rolls 1d10.

If the settlement has Records, add +6 to the result.

Gaming Gazebo is a settlement location found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. When unlocked, it replaces the starting settlement location.

Gaming Gazebo introduces the following rules, endeavor, and gear.

Gaming Gazebo.
The light of inspiration persists. You may continue to innovate.

Gear.

Gorm Climate is a settlement event card found in the Gorm Expansion.
Card Text.
The returning survivors find the settlement tormented by relentless foul weather. Add Gorm Climate to the next lantern year on the timeline and roll 1d10.

is an innovation card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

When a survivor dies during the hunt or
showdown phase, gain +2 .

When a survivor dies during the
settlement phase, gain +1 .

is an innovation card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
The soft glow of its light
fills the survivors with a
sense of security.
Departing survivors gain +1 survival.

The survivor attempts
to pull the weapon free
from the ground. Roll
1d10 and add their
strength. If the result is
12+, gain the Lantern Halberd rare gear and
lose this innovation
(archive this card).

An innovation card found within the Sunstalker Expansion.

Card Text.
The settlement embraces their protective feelings. All survivors gain the Overcharge survival action.

Overcharge: If you have any +1 strength tokens, you may spend 1 survival and remove them all to give your next attack this round gain 
Devastating 1. Limit, once per round.

Add hands of the sun consequences to the innovation deck.

is an innovation card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
When a survivor uses the Synchronized Strike fighting art, their attack assist may spend 1 survival to change any monster to a FAILURE before any wound attempts are made. Limit, once per attack.

The Lantern Hoard is a settlement location found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game. It is unlocked during the People of the Lantern story event Returning Survivors.

Location Text.
Innovate.
Cost:
1x 
1x Bone
1x Organ
1x Hide

Once per Settlement Phase, you may spend the listed resources to draw 2 innovation cards. Keep 1 and return the other to the deck.

 Build Bone Smith 
 Build Skinnery 
 Build Organ Grinder

Shared Experience.
Nominate a survivor that has 2 or more Hunt XP than yourself. They describe illuminating details of their destined death. If you are not deaf, gain +1 Hunt XP from their story. If the nominated survivor has a shattered jaw, instead gain +1 insanity.

is an innovation card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
 Heat
By agitating lanterns, a source of Heat
becomes available to the settlement.

Departing Survivors gain +1 survival.

Add lantern oven consequences to the
innovation deck.

An innovation card found within the Spidicules Expansion.

Card Text.
Departing survivors gain +2 insanity.
Spend only 1 here per settlement phase.

 Add 1 Web Silk strange resource to
settlement storage.

 A survivor with 10+ insanity may put the
Spidicules out of its misery. Gain the
Grinning Visage rare gear and lose this
innovation. (Archive this card).

Lorekeeper is a Dragon King hunt event card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
A gnarled old crone approaches the hunting party. Her fingers are sewn together and strange black marks shift around on the palms of her hands. "I am the Lorekeeper. See me and remember." Nominate a survivor to investigate. Roll 1d10.Roll 1d10 - Nominated Survivor

is an innovation card found within the Frogdog Expansion.

Card Text.
An interpreter of radical change.

 : The Mere Navi spends 3 omens to add Metamorphosis Festival to the next lantern year on the timeline.

 : Transmogrify. If there is no Mere Navi, a survivor consumes Golden Frog, if they survive, they become the Mere Navi.

 : Bitter Prophecy. The Mere Navi archives Gilled Fugus. The settlement gains a +1 insanity departing survivor bonus. (Record this on your settlement sheet.)

the last showdown and roll 1d10.

Card text.
Share +1 Forum Knowledge

Anthocyanins. Gain +1 lumi.

Omega-3. Gain +4 lumi.

Protein Training. Gain +1 accuracy and +1 strength. Limit once per lifetime.

is an innovation card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
The settlement swells with creative energy. All survivors gain the Dash survival action.

Dash: Once per round, spend 1 survival to gain +1 and use it immediately. (See detailed rules in rulebook.)

is an innovation card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.
Card Text.
 : Nominate two survivors. They pair
off, and each gains the Partner ability. A
survivor may be nominated for 
Partnership once per lifetime.

Partner - "(Partner's Name)": When you
both Arrive, gain survival up to the
survival limit. Partners may only nominate
each other for Intimacy. When a
partner dies, the remaining partner gains
a random disorder and loses this ability.

See Also.
Principle: Bonding

Phantom is a settlement event card found in the Slenderman Expansion.
Card Text.
Survivors find themselves overcome with a bittersweet mix of affection and loss that haunts them in different moments and places around the settlement.

For each innovation the settlement has listed below, roll 1d10 on its corresponding table.

Requires Language.

Requires Bed.

Requires Storytelling.

is an innovation card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
At the start of a survivor's act, they may
decide to skip their act and Run Away.

After a hunt event is resolved, a survivor may
decide it's time to go home and Run Away.

Add pictograph consequences to the
innovation deck.

is an innovation card found within the Gambler's Chest Expansion. It replaces Pictograph in campaigns with Scouts.
Card Text.
The first time a Level 3+ quarry monster is defeated by survivors accompanied by a scout, gain the Scout Discovery for that monster.

Add pictograph consequences to the innovation deck.

is a set of prototype rules found in the Till Death Do Us Part white box expansion. It allows the settlement to access a new set of principles for use by the survivors.
Card Text.
This is prototype content.
When your settlement innovates Partnership, select a Bonding Principle: Enduring Legacy or Devoted Union.

When a pair of survivors become partners, they gain the benefits and abilities of your chosen Bonding Principle, instead of gaining the benefits of Partnership.

Devoted Union.
Nominate two survivors. They gain the Partner ability. Limit, once per lifetime.

Partner - "(Partner's Name)": Partners may only nominate each other for Intimacy. When your partner dies, gain a random disorder and lose this ability.

During the survivors' turn, while you and your partner are within range of the monster you may perform a combined attack. Limit, once per round.

Combined attack: Partners each spend and activate a weapon. They simultaneously make attack rolls, determining hits based on their individual accuracy. Draw hit locations for all hits together. Resolve hit locations one at a time. Partners choose which survivor attempts to wound each hit location (including the trap). Each partner may not make more wound attempts than the number of their attack rolls.

Enduring Legacy.
Nominate two survivors. They gain the Partner ability. Limit, once per lifetime.

Partner - "(Partner's Name)": Partners may only nominate each other for Intimacy. When your partner dies, gain a random disorder and lose this ability.

Children of partners may inherit one point of a positive attribute and one fighting art from among their parents. They gain these benefits when parents give birth or adopt. During the Settlement Phase, partners may adopt an unnamed survivor that has never departed the settlement. Survivors may only inherit from parents once per lifetime.

When parents have 3+ children, their family is complete. They retire and stop having children forever.

is an innovation card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

roll twice and pick 1 result.

is an innovation card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
 You gain the Scholar of Death secret fighting art.

 You laboriously create a volume about a monster you have defeated during your lifetime. Add "Monster Name" Vol. X where X is the level of the defeated monster, to the Settlement Record Sheet. The work is exhausting, you retire. There can be up to 3 volumes for each monster.

is an innovation card found within the Gambler's Chest Expansion.

Card Text.
You bare your soul to create an inspirational statue. Skip the
next hunt and lose a knowledge (it will be embodied in the statue). Note this on the Settlement Record Sheet.
A settlement can only ever have one inspirational
statue.

Always Share this knowledge in addition to others at the Forum. It costs 1 less lumi to gain.

The settlement develops a silent form of communication to cope with the ever-present din of snoring dreamers. All survivors gain the Fist Pump survival action.

Fist Pump: Once per round, if standing, spend
1 survival to gesture to a Non-blind Survivor.
They stand if knocked down.

Song of Concord is an innovation card in the Gambler's Chest Expansion.

Card text.
Departing survivors start their hunt with this whispered song, each gaining +5 survival.

Archive this when you hunt Smog Singers.

Card Text.
The survivors lift their voices into
the darkness. On Arrival, each non-deaf
survivor may remove 1 negative

During the Overwhelming Darkness story
event, each non-deaf survivor may select
the Path of the Brave.

Card Text.

 If Black Harvest is not on the timeline, Underground Sow.

An innovation card found within the Sunstalker Expansion.

Card Text.
Survival Limit: +1

All survivors gain the Embolden survival action.

Embolden: Once per round, if you have no +1 strength tokens, spend 1 survival to gain a +1 strength token. When you are knocked down, lose all +1 strength tokens.

Add Ammonia, Drums, Hovel, Paint,
Symposium, and Hands of the Sun to the
innovation deck.

Supreme Cuisine is an innovation card in the Gambler's Chest Expansion.

Card text.
Survival Limit +3

Food is a light in the darkness. Returning survivors get +2 lumi.

Monster Style. Select a quarry monster. If the settlement has earned at least 10 CC from the monster, gain its meal gear card.

is an innovation card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Survival Limit: +1

When rolling on the Intimacy story event,
roll twice and pick the lowest result. All current and newborn survivors gain +1 strength and evasion.

Once per lifetime, a survivor may reroll a single roll result. They must keep this new result.

The Sun is a settlement location found in the Sunstalker Expansion. It is unlocked during the People of the Sun story event The Pool and the Sun.

Location Text.
Extreme Heat.
Survivors cannot wear heavy gear1.
Super Nova.
If you suffer defeat against a nemesis monster, the sun cleanses the settlement, instantly killing everyone. Game Over.
Innovate.
Cost:
1x 
1x Bone
1x Organ
1x Hide

Once per Settlement Phase, you may spend the listed resources to draw 2 innovation cards. Keep 1 and return the other to the deck.
Build One.
Bone Smith
Organ Grinder
Skinnery

Notes.
1: The heavy gear restriction only applies to armor. Survivors may still equip heavy weapons.

The Throne is a settlement location found in the Dragon King Expansion. It is unlocked during the People of the Stars story event Foundlings.

Location Text.
Innovate.
Cost:
1x 
1x Hide
1x Bone
1x Organ

Once per Settlement Phase, you may spend the listed resources to draw 2 innovation cards. Keep 1 and return the other to the deck.

Fear and Trembling.
The cowering settlement turns their squinting gaze to the lone figure that mounts the obsidian steps.

Once per settlement phase, a survivor may spend to approach the throne and roll 1d10.

Build One.
Bone Smith
Organ Grinder
Skinnery

is an innovation card found within the Black Knight Expansion.
Card Text.
 : Corrupt - Gain Dishonorable.

Survivors with Dishonorable may always depart.

Survivors with Honorable can no longer depart.

When a new survivor is born, you may add
1 Life String strange resource to storage.

 Umbilical Symbiosis

 Special Innovate Pottery
Cost.

Notes.
Editor Note: The Life String strange resource's card is included in the Legendary Card Pack I (1.6 Update). -- October 16, 2024
Author Note: The Life String strange resource does not have a card to represent it. --Maximo1984 (talk) 14:05, August 28, 2019 (UTC)

An innovation card found within the Manhunter Expansion.

Card Text.
Survival Limit: +1

A dangerous room of plans and tools.

Quarries cannot move off the hunt board. If the survivors would move backwards on the hunt board, roll 1d10. On a 4+, they don't.

The hunt team makes a plan. The group
may reroll 1 Hunt Event Table result (d100) 
this lantern year. They must reroll before
performing the event.
